alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 9:43PM EST until January 30 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Westham affecting Henrico, City of Richmond and Chesterfield Counties. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Cartersville, Richmond Westham...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Richmond Westham. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding along both banks. No damage at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.0 feet on 02/05/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 945 AM EST.
